channel.title: Taxpayer Advocate Service Feed
channel.description: The Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) is an independent organization within the IRS that recommends changes to the tax system and helps taxpayers resolve problems with the IRS.

item.title: TAS Helps Taxpayer Attend Family Funeral
item.description: When one taxpayer submitted her passport to the IRS to obtain an Individual Taxpayer Identification Number (ITIN), she unexpectedly needed to return to her home country to attend her father’s funeral. TAS worked with the IRS to quickly retrieve her passport so she could return home to be with her family. Visit the Success Stories page on the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit to read the full story.

item.title: TAS Clears Way to College by Removing Lien
item.description: Years after inheriting an insurance settlement from her mother, a young woman was denied a loan to attend college due to a federal tax lien stemming from the settlement. Several failed attempts at getting the IRS to withdraw the lien led the taxpayer to a TAS case advocate. Visit the Success Stories page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit to learn how the case advocate was able to resolve this issue.

item.title: Small Business Health Care Tax Credit Estimator Available
item.description: TAS has a tool to help small businesses determine whether they’re eligible for the Small Business Health Care Tax Credit and, if so, estimate the amount they could receive. Visit the Small Business Health Care Tax Credit Estimator page on the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit for more information.

item.title: TAS Drives Lien Relief Efforts
item.description: A TAS case advocate pushed the IRS to discharge a taxpayer’s lien within 24 hours so the taxpayer could sell his property. Learn more about how TAS helped this man on the Success Stories page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: TAS Advocates for Small Business
item.description: TAS helped a small business partnership get relief from $10,000 in penalties when it failed to file a tax return for multiple years. Read the full story about how TAS was able to help this business on the Success Stories page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: TAS Helps Taxpayer Avoid Penalty
item.description: A taxpayer came to TAS seeking a partial abatement of the failure to file penalty for a late-filed return. Find out how TAS was able to help this taxpayer on the Success Stories page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: Resources for International Taxpayers Available
item.description: Important information and resources for U.S. taxpayers living and working abroad are now available on the Resources for International Taxpayers page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: TAS Persistence Helps Taxpayer Suffering from Medical Condition Avoid Penalties
item.description: When a taxpayer with a medical condition was penalized for filing late, a TAS case advocate and the taxpayer’s psychologist teamed up to help. Learn how they worked to obtain penalty relief from the IRS on the Success Stories page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate on C-SPAN
item.description: VIDEO: National Taxpayer Advocate Nina Olson recently discussed her FY2014 Objectives Report to Congress and more on C-SPAN’s Washington Journal. Watch the video or visit the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit to learn more about the report and other tax topics.

item.title: NTA Releases FY2014 Objectives Report to Congress
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson’s FY2014 Objectives Report to Congress, released on June 26, 2013, identifies priority issues the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) will focus on during the upcoming fiscal year. The report expresses particular concern about the IRS’s unwillingness to issue full refunds to victims of tax preparer fraud, the impact of budget cuts on the IRS’s ability to meet taxpayer needs, and shortcomings in IRS procedures for assisting victims of tax-related identity theft. This year’s report also includes a special report examining the IRS’s use of questionable criteria to screen applicants for tax-exempt status. Learn more about the NTA’s priority issues on the FY2014 Objectives Report to Congress page of the Tax Toolkit.

item.title: NTA on Same-Sex Marriage and Taxation
item.description: Same-sex marriage is legal in 12 states and Washington, D.C., but the Defense of Marriage Act (DOMA) prohibits federal recognition of same-sex marriages. As a result, domestic partners and same-sex spouses face unique challenges related to their federal taxes, such as those outlined in the pending United States v. Windsor Supreme Court case. In her 2012 Annual Report to Congress, National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson pushes for guidance from the IRS on federal tax questions that continue to cause difficulties for same-sex couples. Learn more about the most serious problems facing taxpayers today in the NTA’s 2012 Annual Report to Congress.

item.title: TAS Convinces IRS to Forgive Penalties Due to IRS Error
item.description: Two years after mistakenly allowing a taxpayer to claim the 2009 First-Time Homebuyer Credit, the IRS discovered its error. The problem was further compounded when the IRS imposed a penalty on the taxpayer due to apparent underpayment on their tax return. See how TAS was able to help on the Success Stories page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: TAS Advocates for Penalty Relief; Protect Your Tax Refund
item.description: When a taxpayer came to TAS for civil penalty relief assistance, the case advocate uncovered not only one, but three years’ worth of penalties. Find out how TAS convinced the IRS to correct this taxpayer’s balance to zero on the Success Stories page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit. In addition, it’s key to obtain a signed copy of your tax return from your preparer to protect your tax refund, and guard against tax return fraud. Learn more about choosing a tax preparer.

item.title: Upcoming Closures for TAS and IRS
item.description: Due to the current budget situation, including the sequester, all IRS and TAS offices will be closed on May 24, June 14, July 5, July 22 and Aug. 30, 2013. Tax-filing and payment deadlines will remain the same. More information about the impact of the shutdown is available on IRS.gov.

item.title: Return Preparer Test Refund Update
item.description: Some preparers made appointments to take the test to become a registered return preparer, and paid the required fee. Since a U.S. District Court issued an injunction stopping the testing, the IRS is refunding those fees. Learn more about this news and related information on the Registered Tax Return Preparer Test page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: New Success Story: TAS Saves Taxpayer’s Car from Repossession
item.description: When a taxpayer whose return was being delayed by the IRS was facing a possible repossession of his vehicle, TAS stepped in to help. See how his TAS case advocate saved the day on the on the Success Stories page of the Tax Toolkit.

item.title: NTA makes the case for regulating tax preparers
item.description: Each year, taxpayers hire paid practitioners to prepare and file nearly 80 million individual tax returns, due to the overwhelming complexity of the tax code. Efforts by the IRS and Treasury to regulate preparers were halted when a U.S. district court found, in the Loving v. IRS case, that Treasury lacked authority to issue such standards. The National Taxpayer Advocate believes the district court’s decision in this case is based in part on an outdated understanding of return preparation and filing. In a recent Tax Notes Special Report she makes a strong case for preparer regulation. Read the full report on the Tax Toolkit.

item.title: TAS Case Advocates: Your Voice at the IRS
item.description: TAS case advocates assist qualifying taxpayers nationwide in resolving problems with the IRS. Identity theft was the most common issue in TAS casework during fiscal year 2012 (10/1/11 – 9/30/12) and rose 61 percent over the last fiscal year. TAS also found an increasing number of taxpayers were defrauded by tax preparers. Learn more about TAS Case Advocacy on the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson Testifies on IRS Budget
item.description: In her recent testimony before Congress, National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson notes the IRS could only answer 57 percent of calls on tax day – an “F” in any grading book. Learn more about IRS budget issues and the NTA’s recommendations in her testimony before Congress on the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s Tax Toolkit.

item.title: Taxpayer Advocate Service: Advocacy in Action; Improvements to Online PTIN System
item.description: TAS received nearly 220,000 new cases in FY2012. In addition, identity theft-related cases rose 97 percent. Learn more about TAS’s mission and work on the Who We Are page of the Tax Toolkit. In addition, learn about the recent improvements to the IRS’s online Preparer Tax Identification Number (PTIN) system on the Renewing or Applying for a PTIN page.

item.title: NTA Interviewed on Tax-Related Identity Theft; Video Explains What to Expect From TAS; New Tax Reform Comments Available
item.description: In a recent interview on Federal News Radio, National Taxpayer Advocate Nina Olson outlines the recent dramatic increase in tax-related identity theft, discusses how TAS and the IRS are working to help victims and the proposed new civil penalties for those who commit identity theft. In addition, new tax reform comments submitted by members of the public are now available on the Tax Reform Suggestions page of the Tax Toolkit.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate Nina Olson Testifies on Tax Fraud and Tax ID Theft
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate Nina Olson testified before the U.S. Senate Finance Committee on April 16 about several key tax issues, including tax fraud, tax identity theft and tax reform. Read her testimony on the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: 2013 Tax Forum Registration, PTIN Renewal Applications Update
item.description: Each year, TAS participates in the IRS Nationwide Tax Forums, a three-day series of tax education and networking conferences for tax professionals. Learn about registration, dates and locations for the 2013 Forums on the TAS at the IRS Nationwide Tax Forums page on the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit. In addition, all enrolled agent renewal applications for SSNs ending in 0, 1, 2 or 3 submitted by Jan. 31, 2013, have been processed and new renewal cards should be received within 10 days. More information about the PTIN system is available in the Tax Preparer Regulation section.

item.title: Low Income Taxpayer Clinic (LITC) Program Reports on Activities
item.description: The Low Income Taxpayer Clinic (LITC) Program, administered by TAS, has issued its first program report and related infographic. The report summarizes how clinics assist thousands of low income taxpayers through pro bono representation, education and advocacy efforts. Learn more about LITCs on the Low Income Taxpayer Clinics page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: Sequestration and EITC Information, New Tax Reform Comments Added to Tax Toolkit
item.description: Learn how the sequestration cuts will reduce the refundable portion of the Small Business Health Care Tax Credit for some small, tax-exempt employers, and access updated information about the 2012 Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC) on the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit. In addition, read new tax reform suggestions submitted by members of the public on the Tax Reform Suggestion Box page.

item.title: New Tax Reform Suggestions on Tax Toolkit
item.description: New suggestions from taxpayers regarding ways to reform the tax system are available on the Tax Reform Suggestion Box page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit. Visit this page to read various taxpayers’ thoughts on reform and submit your own ideas.

item.title: New Tax Reform Suggestions Posted to Tax Toolkit
item.description: New tax reform suggestions submitted by members of the public are available on the Tax Reform Suggestion Box page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit. Visit this page to read other taxpayer perspectives and submit your own ideas about tax reform.

item.title: PTIN Requirements Not Affected by Court Ruling on Tax Preparer Regulation
item.description:
On Jan. 18, 2013, the U.S. District Court of the District of Columbia issued an injunction to keep the IRS from enforcing regulatory requirements for tax return preparers. In accordance with this order, tax return preparers covered by this program are not required to complete competency testing or secure continuing education. The ruling does not affect the regulatory practice requirements for CPAs, attorneys, enrolled agents, enrolled retirement plan agents or enrolled actuaries. 
 
On Feb. 1, 2013, the court released a modified order clarifying that all paid tax return preparers must still obtain a PTIN. Following this clarification, the IRS has reopened the PTIN system. Learn the specifics about what this ruling means for tax professionals on the Tax Preparer Regulation page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: IRS Announces Processing of Returns Claiming Education Credits by mid-February
item.description: The IRS recently announced that taxpayers using Form 8863, Education Credits, can begin filing their tax returns for processing in mid-February. Form 8863 is used to claim two higher education credits – the American Opportunity Tax Credit and the Lifetime Learning Credit. Learn more about tax credits available to you on the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS)’s Tax Toolkit.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate Nina Olson Releases 2012 Annual Report to Congress; Identifies Most Serious Problems Facing Taxpayers Today
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate Nina Olson released her 2012 Annual Report to Congress on Jan. 9, 2013. The report identifies the most serious problems facing taxpayers today, such as the complexity of the U.S. tax code, reduced IRS funding, and the rise in tax-related identity theft, and provides the IRS and highest levels of government with recommendations for resolving them. For more information and access to the full report, visit the 2012 Annual Report to Congress site.

item.title: Small Business Health Care Tax Credit Estimator Now Available and Change to RSS Feed Email Delivery
item.description:
A new tool is available that helps small businesses determine whether they’re eligible for the Small Business Health Care Tax Credit and if so, estimate the amount they could receive. Visit the Small Business Health Care Tax Credit Estimator for more information.

In addition, please note, if you receive the Tax Toolkit RSS Feed via Feed My Inbox, you will need to take action to continue receiving these updates, as Feed My Inbox is shutting down in early January. Visit the RSS Feed page for instructions.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson Discusses the “Fiscal Cliff” on C-SPAN
item.description: NTA Nina Olson appeared on C-SPAN and discussed the “fiscal cliff” and its potential impact on taxes on Dec. 14, 2012. A link to the video is now available on the home page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s Tax Toolkit.

item.title: Taxpayer Advocate Service Area Director Position
item.description: Would you like to lead a team of dedicated people, protecting taxpayer rights and making a difference in the lives of thousands of Americans each year? The Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) is looking for an Area Director, based in Manhattan, to manage seven of our local offices. Learn more about this position or apply for this position via the Area Director job listing.

item.title: LITC Director Receives NTA Award
item.description: Mark Moreau, director of Southeast Louisiana Legal Services (SLLS) Low Income Taxpayer Clinic, has received the National Taxpayer Advocate Award for his years of work on behalf of low income taxpayers, including outstanding efforts following Hurricane Katrina and the Gulf oil spill. Learn more about Mark’s work with SLLS on the Low Income Taxpayer Clinics page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: Video Now Available: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson’s Testimony on Identity Theft and Tax Fraud
item.description: NTA Nina Olson testified before the House Committee on Oversight & Government Reform yesterday. Olson addressed tax-related identity theft and tax fraud as growing problems for the IRS. A video of her testimony is now available on the Committee on Oversight & Government Reform’s website or the Speeches and Testimony page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson Testifies on Identity Theft and Tax Fraud
item.description: NTA Nina Olson testified before the House Committee on Oversight & Government Reform. Olson addressed tax-related identity theft and tax fraud as growing problems for the IRS. Read her written statement on the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: Taxpayer Advocacy Panel (TAP) Releases 2011 Annual Report
item.description: The Taxpayer Advocacy Panel (TAP) recently released its 2011 Annual Report, highlighting the 41 recommendations and 25 projects TAP provided to the IRS for improving customer service and satisfaction. TAP is a Federal Advisory Committee that makes recommendations to the IRS and the National Taxpayer Advocate. More information about TAP’s 2011 accomplishments is available on TAP’s website, ImproveIRS.org, or the Taxpayer Advocacy Panel page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: New Centralized Authorization File (CAF) Fax Numbers Available
item.description: The IRS has made changes to Centralized Authorization File (CAF) fax numbers that impact tax professionals sending Form 2848 and Form 8821 (power of attorney forms). The Philadelphia Campus CAF Unit fax number is unchanged: (267) 941-1017. The new fax number for Memphis is (855) 214-7519 and the new fax number for Ogden is (855) 214-7522. For more information, visit the CAF page on IRS.gov. Tax professionals can access additional materials and resources on the Tax Professionals page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: New Resources for Small Businesses, Info on Upcoming Filing Extension Deadline, Temporary ITIN Requirements and e-file
item.description:
New resources to assist small businesses in preparation for year-end reporting are available on the Small Business Recordkeeping page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit. 

The IRS has also released additional information about specific tax deadlines and requirements. If you filed an extension on your 2011 tax return, the IRS’s Fresh Start Penalty Relief extension deadline of October 15, 2012, is rapidly approaching. The IRS has also clarified temporary ITIN application requirements for noncitizens with tax extensions and many foreign students. In addition, if you’re interested in becoming an IRS e-file service provider, your application must now be completed online.

item.title: Taxpayer Advocate Service Seminar from IRS Nationwide Tax Forums Available For Download
item.description: Each year, the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) hosts seminars focused on taxpayer rights and other key tax issues at the IRS Nationwide Tax Forums. Seminars from the 2012 Tax Forums are now available for download and continuing professional education (CPE) credits.  These sessions are one of the many resources TAS offers to tax professionals. Learn more about 2012 Tax Forums on the Nationwide Tax Forums page of the TAS Tax Toolkit.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina E. Olson Named to Accounting Today’s Top 100 Most Influential People of 2012
item.description: NTA Nina E. Olson was recently named one of Accounting Today’s Top 100 Most Influential People of 2012. The list includes leading innovators in the tax and accounting industry. Read more about Nina Olson on the From the NTA page on the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: Success Story: TAS Gets Penalty Removed
item.description: When one married couple turned to the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) after misunderstanding adoption credit criteria, TAS helped them clear the air and avoid IRS penalties. Check out this story, and others, on the Success Stories page of the TAS Tax Toolkit.

item.title: Success Story: Getting a Fresh Start
item.description: When the IRS refused to accept one taxpayer’s proposal to pay his debt, TAS helped the taxpayer win the debt tug of war and get a fresh start. Check out this story, and others, on the Success Stories page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit, and see how TAS helps taxpayers.

item.title: Reminder: Registered Tax Return Preparer Test
item.description: If you’re required to take the Registered Tax Return Preparer (RTRP) test and have not done so, please check your inbox and spam for an email from the Return Preparer Office. Schedule your test today to ensure that you’re able to obtain your preferred date, time and location. Learn more about requirements for tax preparers on the Tax Professionals page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: Success Story: TAS Finds “Alternative” Documents to Support FTHBC
item.description: When the IRS challenged a taxpayer’s right to claim the First-Time Homebuyer Credit by stating his home didn’t qualify, TAS helped the taxpayer gather evidence to prove its existence – and get the credit he deserved. Check out this story, and others, on the Success Stories page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit, and see how TAS helps taxpayers.

item.title: Louisiana Low Income Taxpayer Clinic Wins American Bar Association Award
item.description: Southeast Louisiana Legal Services, a Low Income Taxpayer Clinic (LITC), was recently awarded the American Bar Association’s 2012 Hodson Award for Public Service. Watch a video of LITC Program Director Bill Nelson talking about this exciting achievement on the Low Income Taxpayer Clinics page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit. TAS manages the LITC program to provide tax assistance to low income taxpayers and those who speak English as a second language.

item.title: NTA Testifies Before House Committee on Affordable Care Act Tax Provisions
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson testified before the U.S. House of Representatives Committee on Oversight & Government Reform on Aug. 2 about the tax-related provisions of the Affordable Care Act. Read her testimony or learn more tax information on the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: Success Story: Hospitalized Taxpayer Gets Help, Levy Release and Funds Returned
item.description: It’s no secret hospital visits can be taxing. Visit the Success Stories page on TAS’s Tax Toolkit to learn how TAS helped a hospitalized taxpayer get a Social Security levy lifted and funds returned.

item.title: CBS New York Features Taxpayer Advocate Service: Waiting For an IRS Refund
item.description: When a New York taxpayer was experiencing economic hardship from a delayed refund and had failed to receive an answer, the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) was able to help. Watch the story on an Ask Asa segment from CBS New York. You can learn more about how TAS helps taxpayers on the Success Stories page of the TAS Tax Toolkit. In addition, the IRS recently announced efforts to help U.S. citizens residing overseas catch up with tax filing obligations and provide assistance to people with foreign retirement plan issues.

item.title: Success Story: Stop That Lien!
item.description: Discovering you owe more on your taxes than you can pay at the moment is never ideal. Check out the Success Stories page of TAS’s Tax Toolkit to see how TAS helped one small business owner navigate the IRS, prevented a lien and helped her stay in business.

item.title: Success Story: TAS Gets Refund for Earthquake Victim Using Unconventional Means
item.description: Natural disasters like floods and storms are top of mind for many taxpayers this week. Check out the Success Stories page of TAS’s Tax Toolkit to see how TAS helped one taxpayer get his refund after an unexpected run in with Mother Nature.

item.title: NTA Testifies Before House Committee on Tax-Related Identity Theft and Refund Fraud
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson testified before the House of Representatives Committee on the Judiciary about tax-related identity theft and refund fraud on June 28, 2012. Read her testimony on the NTA Testimony and Speeches page. For more tax information, visit the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate Releases FY 2013 Objectives Report to Congress
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina E. Olson released her Fiscal Year 2013 Objectives Report to Congress on June 27, 2012, identifying priority issues the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) will focus on during the upcoming year. The report expresses particular concern about the taxpayer impact of expired and expiring tax provisions, and the rise in tax fraud and tax-related identity theft. Find out more and read the full report on the Fiscal Year 2013 Objectives Report to Congress page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) website.

item.title: New Tax Resources for Military Members Now Available
item.description: The National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) and her employees appreciate the commitment, dedication and sacrifice of the U.S. Armed Forces. Information on special tax provisions and resources for military members in now available on the Military Members page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit. Resources include information on identity theft, Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC) and the First Time Homebuyer Credit (FTHBC).

item.title: Success Story: TAS Helps Taxpayers Defrauded by Preparer
item.description: Refund theft by some tax return preparers is an important issue for TAS and the National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA). Recent media coverage has focused on legislation that would increase penalties for tax preparers who defraud taxpayers. Now, you can learn about how TAS helped two victims of tax-related fraud receive correct refunds on the Success Stories page of TAS’s Tax Toolkit.

item.title: IRS Limits Issuance of EINs; Information on Upcoming IRS Webinars
item.description: The IRS announced it will limit the issuance of all Employer Identification Numbers (EIN) to one per responsible party each day, a change from the current limit of five per day, on May 21, 2012. Learn more about EINs and other Business Tax Basics on the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit. In addition, information about upcoming IRS webinars for small businesses is available on the Small Business Tax Help and Resources page.

item.title: IRS Helps Struggling Taxpayers and College-Bound Students; Form W-2 Reporting Information
item.description: The IRS announced the expansion of its Fresh Start initiative by extending the terms in the Offer in Compromise (OIC) program to reach and assist extremely financially distressed taxpayers. The IRS is also helping college-bound students complete the FAFSA form in much less time with the IRS Data Retrieval Tool. In addition, information about Form W-2 reporting of employer-sponsored health coverage is now available on the Business Tax Basics page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: NTA Testifies Before Congress on Tax Fraud and Identity Theft
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson testified before the House Committee on Ways and Means on May 8, 2012, about tax fraud and identity theft. Read her testimony. For more tax information, visit the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: IRS Accepting Applications for Low Income Taxpayer Clinic (LITC) Grants
item.description: The IRS announced today the opening of the Low Income Taxpayer Clinic (LITC) grant application period. The LITC program awards matching grants of up to $100,000 per year to qualifying organizations to develop, expand or maintain an LITC. LITC supports organizations serving low-income people dealing with tax controversy with the IRS along with those providing outreach and education to taxpayers speaking English as a second language (ESL). Learn more about LITCs on the LITC page of the Tax Toolkit.

item.title: Taxpayer Advocate Service at the 2012 IRS Nationwide Tax Forums
item.description: New information about Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) seminars and focus groups at the 2012 IRS Nationwide Tax Forums is now available on the TAS at the IRS Nationwide Tax Forums page on the Tax Toolkit. Seminars will include presentations on assisting clients who have experienced domestic violence and abuse and helping clients understand their rights, and focus groups will include conversations surrounding the Automated Collection System (ACS), IRS automated processes and how to improve interactions with the IRS.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate Testifies Before Congress on Tax Compliance and Identity Theft
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson testified before Congress on April 19, 2012, about tax compliance and identity theft. Watch a video of her testimony  or read her testimony. For more tax information, visit the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: NTA Talks Tax Code Complexity on C-SPAN’s Washington Journal
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson discussed the complexity of the tax code, tax issues facing taxpayers and the role of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) on C-SPAN’s Washington Journal on April 16, 2012. Olson also proposed virtual face-to-face audits to improve the IRS correspondence examination process, something she discusses in her latest blog post. Watch her interview. The NTA has also recently been featured in articles from Bloomberg and Christian Science Monitor. For more tax information, visit the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: Last-Minute Filing Tips from the IRS
item.description: As Tax Day approaches, the IRS has posted information about what you should do if you can’t file or pay your tax debt by the April 17 deadline. In addition, the IRS has posted YouTube videos with last-minute filing tips in English, Spanish and American Sign Language. For more tax tips and information, visit the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: NTA Nina Olson proposes a prescription for curing IRS’s ailing correspondence examination process
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson proposes a prescription to cure the IRS’s ailing correspondence examination process, using technology to communicate more effectively with taxpayers through virtual face-to-face audits in a new blog post on the National Taxpayer Advocate’s Blog.

item.title: Video of Recent NTA Testimony Now Available; Enrolled Agent Renewal Cards May Be Delayed
item.description: Video of National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson’s recent testimony before the Senate Subcommittee on Fiscal Responsibility and Economic Growth is now available. In addition, the IRS recently announced a delay in the processing of enrolled agent renewal applications. For more tax-related tips and information, visit the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: NTA Testifies on Identity Theft; IRS Launches New Tool
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson testified about identity theft before the Senate Subcommittee on Fiscal Responsibility and Economic Growth on March 20, 2012. You can read her testimony by visiting the Speeches and Testimony page on the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit. In addition, the IRS recently launched a new online search tool, Exempt Organizations Select Check, to help users more easily find key information about tax-exempt organizations, such as federal tax status and filings.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate’s Blog Post Questions Effectiveness of IRS Audits
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate Nina Olson questions whether correspondence examinations (or audits) are as effective as the IRS thinks in a new blog post on the National Taxpayer Advocate’s Blog.

item.title: Expanded Fresh Start Initiative Offers New Penalty Relief and Expanded Installment Agreements
item.description: The Internal Revenue Service is helping struggling taxpayers with new penalty relief to the unemployed and by making Installment Agreements available to more people. Learn more about the expanded Fresh Start Initiative. For more tax-related tips and information, visit the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: IRS Identifies 12 Tax Scams to Watch Out For This Filing Season
item.description: The IRS recently issued its annual “Dirty Dozen” ranking of tax scams, reminding taxpayers to use caution during tax season to protect themselves against a wide range of schemes ranging from identity theft to return preparer fraud. For more tax-related tips and information, visit the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: 2012 Low Income Taxpayer Clinics Announced
item.description: The IRS recently announced the recipients of more than $9 million in matching grants for 2012 Low Income Taxpayer Clinics (LITC). More information about the LITC program, which is administered by the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS), can be found on the TAS Tax Toolkit.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate’s Blog Post Discusses Need for Taxpayer Bill of Rights
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson stresses the need to enact a Taxpayer Bill of Rights in a new blog post on the National Taxpayer Advocate’s Blog.

item.title: New Information for Tax Professionals on Tax Toolkit
item.description: Updated information for tax professionals regarding renewing or applying for a Preparer Tax Identification Number (PTIN) and continuing professional education requirements is now available on the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: TAS Now Offers Virtual Help to Taxpayers via IRS Pilot Program
item.description: Through the new IRS Virtual Service Delivery (VSD) pilot program, TAS can now offer face-to-face assistance through two-way video conferencing to qualifying taxpayers in the Tampa, FL area. The IRS is conducting a limited roll-out of this program at 10 IRS offices and two other sites, and may expand to further sites in the future. Visit the Virtual Tax Help page on the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit for more information.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate Blog Post Explores IRS Correspondence Audits
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate Nina Olson explores the impact of correspondence examinations (or audits) on taxpayer rights in a new blog post on the National Taxpayer Advocate’s Blog.

item.title: Updated Tax Credit Information on Tax Toolkit
item.description: Updated information about several different tax credits has been added to the Education Tax Benefits, American Recovery and Reinvestment Act and Health Care Tax Credit pages of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit. Updates reflect information important to the 2011 tax filing season.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate Blog Post Explores IRS Audits
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson explores the difference between “real” and “unreal” IRS audits in a new blog post. Don’t forget to subscribe for RSS updates from the NTA’s blog!

item.guid: Information About Tax Day 2012 and Important Filing Information Added to Tax Toolkit Wednesday, January 18, 2012 9:52:37 AM
item.title: Information About Tax Day 2012 and Important Filing Information Added to Tax Toolkit
item.description: Information about Tax Day 2012 has been added to the home page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit. In addition, links to useful tax filing resources have been added to the Individuals, Get Tax Help, Businesses and Tax Professionals pages.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate Nina E. Olson releases 2011 Annual Report to Congress and Launches Blog
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina E. Olson released her annual report to Congress on Jan. 11, 2012, identifying the combination of the IRS’s expanding workload and declining resources as the most serious problem facing taxpayers. The result, the report says, is inadequate taxpayer service, erosion of taxpayer rights, and reduced tax compliance, especially in light of the increased diversity of the taxpayer population. To coincide with the release of the report, the NTA launched a new blog on taxpayer rights. Read more on the 2011 Annual Report to Congress page on the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.guid: New Information about EITC, Adoption Credit and PTIN Renewals Added to Tax Toolkit Wednesday, January 04, 2012 2:18:47 PM
item.title: New Information about EITC, Adoption Credit and PTIN Renewals Added to Tax Toolkit
item.description: Updated information about the Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC) for Tax Year 2011 has been added to the Earned Income Tax Credit and Family Credit page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit. Updated information is also available about the Adoption Credit for Tax Year 2011 on the Adoption Credit page. In addition, new information about Preparer Tax Identification Number (PTIN) renewals in 2012 has been added to the Renewing or Applying for a PTIN page.

item.title: Information for Taxpayers and Tax Professionals about the Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC)
item.description: New information for individual taxpayers and tax professionals about the Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC) has been added to the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit. EITC is a credit for people who earn low-to-moderate incomes. Eligibility is based on several factors, including the amount and type of earned income, combined income if married and amount of qualifying children. Learn if you qualify for EITC.

item.title: TAS Helps Taxpayers Represented by Roni L. Deutch Law Firm; IRS Begins Registered Tax Return Preparer Competency Test
item.description:
On May 12, 2011, because of a lawsuit filed by the California state attorney general, Roni Lynn Deutch announced that Roni Deutch, A Professional Tax Corporation (i.e., the Roni Deutch law firm) was closing. The court appointed a receiver to wind down the firm's affairs. If you are a former client of this firm and are facing tax problems, the Taxpayer Advocate Service may be able to help. More information is available on the Success Stories page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit. 

In addition, the IRS is beginning the next phase of its effort to increase oversight of the tax preparation industry by launching the new Registered Tax Return Preparer Competency Test. More information is available on the Registered Tax Return Preparer Test page of the TAS Tax Toolkit.

item.title: Information about the Taxpayer Rights Corner Added to Tax Toolkit
item.description: Information about the Taxpayer Rights Corner, your one-stop shop for taxpayer rights information during every step of your interaction with the IRS, has been added to the home page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.guid: Taxpayer Advocacy Panel Releases 2010 Annual Report; IRS Begins PTIN Renewals for 2012 Filing Season Tuesday, October 25, 2011 12:34:15 PM
item.title: Taxpayer Advocacy Panel Releases 2010 Annual Report; IRS Begins PTIN Renewals for 2012 Filing Season
item.description:
The Taxpayer Advocacy Panel (TAP) recently released its 2010 Annual Report, which summarizes its accomplishments in 2010, including 101 new recommendations and 34 completed projects the panel provided to the IRS. TAP is a Federal Advisory Committee that makes recommendations to the IRS and the National Taxpayer Advocate. More information is available on TAP’s website, www.improveirs.org, or the Taxpayer Advocacy Panel page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

In addition, the IRS announced recently that the nation’s 738,000 tax return preparers who have Preparer Tax Identification Numbers (PTINs) can now renew their PTINs for the 2012 filing season. The IRS also issued guidance to implement further return preparer oversight. More information is available on the Renewing or Applying for a PTIN page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: Information in Spanish Now Available on Tax Toolkit
item.description: Information in Spanish has been added to the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit. The new Spanish pages include Acerca de TAS (About TAS), Información Tributaria Básica (Basic Tax Information) and Preguntas Frecuentes (Frequently Asked Questions). You can access the new pages from the ¡Bienvenido! page on the TAS Tax Toolkit.

item.guid: TAS Seminars From 2011 IRS Nationwide Tax Forums Available for Download Tuesday, October 18, 2011 2:21:54 PM
item.title: TAS Seminars From 2011 IRS Nationwide Tax Forums Available for Download
item.description: Tax seminars from the 2011 IRS Nationwide Tax Forums are now available for download on the IRS Nationwide Tax Forums Online. Two seminars are available from the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS), including “Advocating for Your Client in Innocent Spouse Cases” and “Small Business Health Care Tax Credit.” The seminars may be taken by tax professionals for either continuing professional education credit or audit. More information is available on the TAS at the IRS Nationwide Tax Forums page on the TAS Tax Toolkit.

item.title: IRS Issues Guidance to Further Implement Return Preparer Oversight
item.description: The IRS recently provided additional clarification for tax return preparers about when to renew their preparer tax identification numbers (PTINs), how suitability testing will be conducted and when the continuing education requirement will begin. More information is available on the Tax Preparer Regulation page the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: Taxpayer Advocate Service Refocuses Workload
item.description: The Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) is temporarily limiting its acceptance of cases when the taxpayer’s problem solely involves an IRS delay in processing certain tax documents, beginning October 1. More information about this change is available on pages for Individuals and Tax Professionals on the TAS Tax Toolkit.

item.title: Virtual Small Business Tax Workshop on Tax Toolkit
item.description: Information about the Virtual Small Business Tax Workshop has been added to the home page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit. The workshop is composed of nine interactive lessons designed to help new small business owners learn their tax rights and responsibilities.

item.guid: New Videos Available on IRS Collection Efforts Tuesday, September 20, 2011 11:29:00 AM
item.title: New Videos Available on IRS Collection Efforts
item.description: New videos are available that provide basic information regarding IRS collection efforts. View the video series “Owe Taxes? Understanding IRS Collection Efforts.” Additional tax videos are available on www.irsvideos.gov. For more tax information, visit the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit.

item.title: IRS Releases Specifications for Registered Tax Return Preparer Test and Reminds Small Businesses About Heath Care Tax Credit
item.description: As part of its ongoing effort to enhance oversight of the tax preparer industry, the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) released the specifications for the Registered Tax Return Preparer Test on September 6, 2011. Find out more on the Registered Tax Return Preparer Test page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Tax Toolkit. In addition, the IRS is reminding small businesses, small non-profit organizations and professional service providers that there is still time to claim the Small Business Health Care Tax Credit. More information is available on the Health Care Tax Credit page.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate Appointed to Administrative Conference of the United States
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina E. Olson is one of five new members appointed to the Administrative Conference of the United States (ACUS). The Conference is an independent, federal agency dedicated to improving the administrative process through consensus-driven applied research, providing nonpartisan expert advice and recommendations for improvement of federal agency procedure. Learn more about the NTA’s recent appointment.

item.title: New Information About the IRS Fresh Start Initiative Webinar Available on the TAS Tax Toolkit
item.description: The IRS is presenting a live webinar, “Learn about the IRS Fresh Start Initiative – Help for Struggling Taxpayers,” on Aug. 31, 2011, at 2 p.m. ET. Learn more and register.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate Nina E. Olson Responds to IRS Innocent Spouse Rule Change
item.description: The IRS announced today that it will eliminate the two-year limit on certain innocent spouse requests. NTA Nina E. Olson issued a statement responding to this rule change. Read her statement on the Press Releases page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) website.

item.title: Information for Small Businesses and Tax Professionals Added to TAS Website
item.description: Starting July 7, 2011, the IRS began sending letters to about 100,000 individuals who appear to have filed returns in 2011 without a valid Preparer Tax Identification Number (PTIN). More information is available on the Renewing or Applying for a PTIN page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) website. The IRS video Your Guide to an IRS Audit, which provides basic information regarding the small business audit process, has also been added to the Business Tax Basics page. In addition, new information is available about the IRS request for public comment on proposed updated rules for IRS communications with the Office of Appeals.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate Releases FY 2012 Objectives Report to Congress
item.description: The National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina E. Olson released her Fiscal Year 2012 Objectives Report to Congress on June 29, 2011, which outlines the goals and activities planned by the NTA for the coming fiscal year. The report expresses particular concern about the impact of IRS budget cuts on taxpayer service and tax compliance and about IRS lien filing practices. Find out more and read the full report on the Fiscal Year 2012 Objectives Report to Congress page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) website.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate Testifies Before U.S. Senate Committee on Finance
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson testified before the U.S. Senate Committee on Finance: Hearing on Complexity & the Tax Gap on June 28, 2011. Read the NTA’s statement on the Speeches and Testimony page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) website.

item.title: Schedule Announced for TAS Focus Groups at the IRS Nationwide Tax Forums
item.description: The Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) IRS Nationwide Tax Forum focus group schedule has been posted to the TAS website. TAS’s three focus groups include: Publication 1 - Taxpayer Rights - Do Your Clients Understand Their Rights?; TAS and Social Media - Your Voice at the IRS!; and How Do IRS Collection Practices Affect your Small Business Clients? For those who have registered, seminar presentations are also available to download and print on the 2011 IRS Nationwide Tax Forums website.

item.title: IRS Announces Low Income Taxpayer Clinic Grant Recipients
item.description: The IRS recently announced the 2011 Low Income Taxpayer Clinic (LITC) grant recipients. The IRS awarded almost $10 million in matching grants to 165 LITCs this year. The IRS has also announced the opening of the 2012 LITC grant application process. For more information, visit the Low Income Taxpayer Clinics page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) website.

item.title: NTA Provides Testimony to Senate Committee
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina Olson submitted written testimony to the U.S. Senate Appropriations Committee (the Subcommittee on Financial Services and General Government) on June 8 regarding the Internal Revenue Service FY 2012 budget request. Read the NTA’s statement on the Speeches and Testimony page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) website.

item.title: IRS Now Accepting LITC Grant Applications
item.description: The IRS recently announced the opening of the 2012 Low Income Taxpayer Clinic (LITC) grant application process. More information is available on the Low Income Taxpayer Clinics page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) website.

item.title: New Forbes.com Interview, NTA Testimony and IRS Fresh Start Initiative Information Available on TAS Website
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina E. Olson was recently interviewed by Forbes.com about tax reform. The NTA also recently testified before the House Committee on Ways and Means about improper payments in the administration of refundable tax credits. Links to the interview and testimony can be found on the home page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) website. In addition, new information about the IRS’s Fresh Start Initiative is available on the Individuals, Businesses and Tax Professionals sections of the TAS website.

item.title: National Taxpayer Advocate Testifies Before House and Senate Committees
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate (NTA) Nina E. Olson testified today before the House Committee on Ways and Means on Improper Payments in the Administration of Refundable Tax Credits. The NTA also testified today before the Senate Committee on Finance on The Spread of Tax Fraud by Identity Theft: A Threat to Taxpayers, A Drain on the Public Treasury. Read the NTA’s testimonies on the Speeches and Testimony page of www.TaxpayerAdvocate.irs.gov.

item.title: New Small Business Resources Now Available on the TAS website!
item.description: Check out new information about Accelerated Write-Offs for Small Businesses and the IRS Small Business Tax Center now available in the Small Business Tax Help and Resources section of the TAS website!

item.title: New information about the Taxpayer Advocate Service at the IRS Nationwide Tax Forums added to TAS website
item.description: New information is now available on the Taxpayer Advocate Service website about TAS at the IRS Nationwide Tax Forums. Learn about the seminars and focus groups that TAS hosts each year at the IRS Nationwide Tax Forums and how tax professionals can participate! Visit the Taxpayer Advocate Service at the IRS Nationwide Tax Forums page for more information.

item.title: Recent NTA Media Appearances
item.description: Check out recent media appearances by National Taxpayer Advocate Nina Olson, including interviews on CBSNews.com about the complexity of the tax code and ABCNews.com about solving problems with the IRS. More info is available on the In the News page of the TAS website.

item.title: Information about the Adoption Credit and CAP Hearing Requests added to Taxpayer Advocate Service Website
item.description: New information has been added to the Taxpayer Advocate Service website about the Adoption Credit and the IRS’s recent clarification of guidance for some Collection Appeals Program (CAP) hearing requests.

item.title: NTA Testifies on How Complexity of Tax Code Hinders Small Businesses
item.description: The National Taxpayer Advocate testified about how the complexity of the tax code hinders small businesses in terms of job creation and economic growth before the House Committee on Small Businesses on April 13, 2011. Read her testimony on the Speeches and Testimony page of the TAS website.

item.title: Recent NTA Media Appearances
item.description: Check out recent media appearances by National Taxpayer Advocate Nina Olson, including interviews on ABCNews.com about options available for settling tax debts with the IRS and Dow Jones Newswire about the NTA’s testimony before the House Committee on Small Business on April 13, 2011. More info is available on the In the News page of the TAS website.

item.title: NTA Interviewed by Forbes.com
item.description: National Taxpayer Advocate Nina Olson was recently interviewed by Forbes.com about common issues encountered by taxpayers during tax season, such as filing extensions, home foreclosures, and tax credits. Watch the interview on Forbes.com or visit the Taxpayer Advocate Service website for other useful tax information.

item.title: New Success Stories Added to TAS Website
item.description: New examples of how the Taxpayer Advocate Service has helped taxpayers have been added to the Success Stories page of the TAS Website.

item.title: Helpful Tax Information Added to the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s Home Page
item.description: Tax season is in full-swing! New videos and information about choosing a tax preparer, volunteer opportunities for tax professionals and filing your taxes if you do not have a Social Security number has been added to the home page of the Taxpayer Advocate Service website.

item.title: New 2013 Medical Expense Deduction and ITIN Information Available, Changes to RSS Feed Email Delivery
item.description:
New information regarding 2013 medical expense deductions and Individual Taxpayer Identification Number (ITIN) standards is now available on the Taxpayer Advocate Service’s (TAS) Tax Toolkit. 
 
In addition, please note, if you receive the Tax Toolkit RSS Feed via Feed My Inbox, you will need to take action to continue receiving these updates, as Feed My Inbox is shutting down in early January. Visit the RSS feed page for instructions.
